title: Changed REST path matching with RESTEasy Reactive?
body:
### Describe the bug

I am currently migrating a project from RESTEasy Classic to RESTEasy Reactive and found a strange behavior where I am not sure if this is a bug or intended.

Two endpoints of the following kind have been defined (this is not about API design, it was designed by former employees):

- `GET /oh/yes/my` 
- `GET /oh/{id}/my/dear`

With RESTEasy Classic, we don't have any problems calling

- `GET /oh/yes/my`(goes to the first endpoint)
- `GET /oh/yes/my/dear` (goes to the second endpoint)

However, with RESTEasy Reactive, we get

- `GET /oh/yes/my`(goes to the first endpoint)
- `GET /oh/yes/my/dear` (returns a 404)



### Expected behavior

From my understanding RESTEasy Reactive should behave equally like RESTEasy Classic as described above.

### Actual behavior

See above.

### How to Reproduce?

[weird.tar.gz](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/10521151/weird.tar.gz)


### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Linux victoria 5.10.0-21-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 5.10.162-1 (2023-01-21) x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "11.0.16" 2022-07-19 OpenJDK Runtime Environment GraalVM CE 22.2.0 (build 11.0.16+8-jvmci-22.2-b06) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM GraalVM CE 22.2.0 (build 11.0.16+8-jvmci-22.2-b06, mixed mode, sharing)

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.15.3.Final/2.16.0.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

apache-maven-3.8.6

### Additional information

_No response_
